Based in Byron Bay servicing the Northern Rivers area, Gold Coast and beyond. ITAC delivers hassle-free IT solutions to SME businesses who value the ITAC approach. Focussing on long term partnerships, providing expertise in the issues facing SMEs and offering continuous improvement opportunities for clients, ITAC is an IT partner of choice.  itac.technology is growing and is looking for its next ICT Support Engineer who is keen to be part of the ongoing growth and success.     Why choose ITAC?  Location – you can surf, coffee, yoga, sleep or whatever brings out your A-Game Looking to stay in Australia? Sponsorship opportunities available If you are looking for some flexibility and balance this could be the role for you! Have a hand in company growth and direction, shaping your own role to fit your interests and the business needs Our people are priority 1! Be part of a small team with a strong emphasis on values and culture We're agile, honest with open comms and constantly seeking ways to do what we do with enhanced excellence! Use your experience to mentor junior team members No one day is the same! Get exposure to a variety of technologies and projects     In this role, you will be responsible for:  Deploying and managing project in Microsoft 365, Google Workspace and associated cloud services Heading up our development and enhancement of our Managed Support and Cyber Security offering Managing and supporting our Managed Support and Cyber Security Agreement clients Resolving support enquiries within your specialization Sharing general support workload with rest of team Monitoring and responding to incidents in our RMM and other platforms Logging and responding to work via the internal CRM Delivering thoughtful customer service to clients, the ITAC way, with a smile!     More about the role:  This role is flexible with option to start at 3-5 days a week depending on existing skill level A starting salary between $70,000 - $100,000 is offered, tailored to existing skill level and subject to performance based review     What’s ITAC is looking for? If you are keen to join a forward thinking company and think you have what it takes, then please apply now! Send your CV with cover letter to work@itac.technology     Note we are not seeking candidates referred by recruitment agencies.

column13: Oversee the Information and Technology team and guide senior leadership on technology. column3: Lead EWOV’s strategic ICT, data & business improvement initiatives. Drive innovation, manage projects & ensure secure, effective technical services.
column13: Are you an innovative leader with a passion for technology and data-driven decision-making?  Do you enjoy solving complex problems and collaborating with like-minded professionals?  Are you ready to apply your strong leadership and strategic skills to meaningful and challenging work?   If the answer is yes – then WE NEED YOU!   We are looking for someone with experience in extensive experience in technology, analytics, and business improvement to join our extraordinary and close-knit team.       Who we are   The Energy and Water Ombudsman (Victoria) (EWOV) is a not-for-profit, independent and impartial dispute resolution service. We proudly provide Victorian energy and water consumers with free, accessible, and informal dispute resolution. Find out more about who we are and what we do here.       Your new role and team   The Technology, Analytics, and Business Improvement Team (TABI) is dedicated to strategic and operational management of EWOV’s ICT, data, and business improvement services, delivering reliable, secure, and effective technical services.    As part of the Senior Leadership Team, the GM TABI will report directly to the Ombudsman, and lead this multidisciplinary team, setting the strategy to deliver forward-thinking, business and customer value systems and technology, in line with EWOV’s strategic priorities. You will use your extensive experience in technology, analytics, and business process improvement to lead and inspire your team, driving transformative changes across the organiszation.   This position offers full-time hours, with potential consideration for part-time arrangement for the right candidate.    Jump over to our website: https://www.ewov.com.au/about-us/careers to learn more and see the position description.      What you’ll bring    To help you succeed in this role you’ll need to bring:   Demonstrated strategic and operational experience leading technology and data teams.  Ability to work collaboratively across organisations, including at Executive level, to identify and drive initiatives that improve staff and customer outcomes  Exceptional stakeholder management skills and commercial understanding to set and deliver an ICT and data analytics vision and roadmap  Experience managing data environments, ideally for internal and external stakeholders  Involved in designing and implementation of a data governance framework, that delivers data governance policies and procedures to ensure data integrity, security, and compliance.  Leading small- and large-scale ICT and business projects using fit-for-purpose project management principles.  Outstanding communication skills, with stakeholders at all levels including employees, Executive and at board-level, ensuring transparency and fostering trust   Experience managing effective vendor relationships that complement insourced technical team.  Identifying and managing risk through cyber-security, BCP to ensure the security and privacy of consumer and market information  Previous strategic leadership and operational management of IT and data teams is critical.   An engaging and authentic leadership style to foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and excellence.  Mentoring and developing team members, promoting professional growth and ensuring high performance.      What makes working with us great   There are so many great things about working with EWOV, here’s some of our benefits:   truly flexible and hybrid ways of working with life-friendly hours  generous leave entitlements including six weeks annual leave, birthday leave, anniversary leave, end-of-year closure leave, community giving leave & 18 weeks of gender-free paid parental leave  centrally located office in Melbourne CBD close to public transport  inclusive team culture that supports each other, collaborates and innovates  we live and breathe wellbeing with a varied program with something for everyone.  Hear from our staff about what makes working at EWOV great:      How to apply   If you are passionate about finding a role where you can really make a difference and be part of a dynamic industry, we encourage you to apply – even if you don’t meet every single criterion.   Please send through your CV and a brief cover letter outlining how you meet the selection criteria and responding to the questions below, either via Seek or via email to careers@ewov.com.au by 16 August 2024. We will be reviewing applications and may commence interviews prior to the closing date, so please apply as soon as possible if you’d like to be considered.   We are committed to ensuring that we truly represent the Victorian community that we serve, and encourage applications from people of all ages, cultures, abilities, sexual orientation and gender identities to apply. If you have any accessibility needs or require us to adapt our application and recruitment process to suit your needs, please let us know at careers@ewov.com.au.    We also encourage flexible working at EWOV and as such even if a role is advertised as full-time, we invite conversations around other working arrangements and encourage you to apply.

column3: Lead, coordinate and deliver day to day financial operations and a range of workforce planning and human resource management initiatives.
column13: $103K – $119K Total Remuneration Package (pro-rata)  $91K – $105K Base Salary (pro-rata)  Location: Maroochydore  Vacancy No: 5342  Temporary - Full-time (until March 2025)  Applications close: Wednesday, 14 August 2024 11:59pm AEST     Why work with us?  At Council, we’re proud of our region. We collaborate with community to achieve truly sustainable outcomes, enhance our enviable lifestyle, and create award-winning places and spaces that are uniquely Sunshine Coast. So, if you love it here as much as we do, and you want to shape our region for the future – you’ll want to join our team!  With the vision to be Australia’s most sustainable region - Healthy, Smart, and Creative, council is at the forefront of delivering a number of region-shaping projects that will see the region become a hub for innovation, entrepreneurship and creativity, along with opportunities and a lifestyle for all to enjoy.   About the Role  The Digital & Information Services branch delivers agile and transformative information and technology, enabling council to be a leader in providing innovative and sustainable services to its communities.  The Business Implementation Officer will provide high level professional governance advice and project management services in Corporate Governance, including delegations of authority, instruments of appointment, council policies, governance registers and legislative awareness.  Administer and maintain the DIS business, governance, and financial operations. Together with the IT Governance Lead, coordinate and govern the DIS Branch Day to day financial operations. Develop and maintain processes to track the financial status of DIS operations. Lead, coordinate and deliver the operational activities of the branch through liaison with Managers, Coordinators and Team Leaders.  This position is based at the Sunshine Coast City Hall, in the heart of Maroochydore CBD. This state of the art and sustainable building is designed to achieve an innovative and collaborative workspace.  About you  As a Business Implementation Officer, you will have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and the ability to analyse data and trends.  You will possess highly developed communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate persuasively, engage in active listening, consult with a wide range of people at all levels of the Council, fostering collaboration and cooperation.  You will have demonstrated ability to manage projects, supervise staff and systems.  As a requirement of this role, you will possess formal relevant qualifications in business/finance/management, and extensive experience relevant to the position.  Our Culture & Employee Benefits  Council is committed to creating an inclusive, culturally diverse, healthy, skilled and dedicated workplace culture. As an employee you will enjoy a range of benefits and working styles to suit you:  Wellbeing: Your wellbeing is important to us therefore we offer a number of different initiatives such as discounted health related memberships, fitness passport, employee assistance program and development opportunities.  Flexibility: We know it is important to balance life and work, therefore we offer flexible working including a 9-day fortnight and a hybrid WFH model that help you be your best. Extras: Those extras make a difference therefore we offer salary packaging options on novated leases, superannuation, smartphones and devices. We also pay you 17.5% leave loading and generous Superannuation where council will contribute 12% Superannuation in addition to your 6% superannuation contribution.  How to apply  Your written application should include:  A 1-2 page cover letter demonstrating your ability to fulfil the mandatory and desirable requirements on the Position Profile. Keep the key responsibilities in mind when addressing this criteria; and A current resume or curriculum vitae.  Once you have these two documents ready, click ‘Apply Now’ and follow the prompts to complete your application.  Further Information  Helpful information to assist you in completing your application is available on the Sunshine Coast Council website.  To learn more about Council’s vision and projects, you can view the Corporate Plan 2023-2027.  For specific enquiries contact Samantha Plescia during business hours on 0477 100 399.  We're working hard to create an inclusive workplace that reflects the diverse community we serve. If you require adjustments at any stage of the recruitment process, please reach out to the Recruitment Team joinusnow@sunshinecoast.qld.gov.au.   At Sunshine Coast Council, we embrace differences in gender, age, ethnicity, race, cultural background including First Nations, disability, religion and sexual orientation. To deliver the best service to our region we want a workforce that reflects the diverse community that we serve. Sunshine Coast Council strongly encourages all suitable applicants to apply for this role.

column13: Applications close 17 August 2024  Target start date 26 August 2024  Brisbane based position     Autonomous Systems Network Engineer   Trusted Autonomous Systems (TAS) requires an experienced network engineer keen to work directly with TAS - a proven innovation specialist in the Robotics, Autonomous Systems and Artificial Intelligence (RAS-AI) domain - and our Defence partners, to accelerate RAS-AI technology transfer into capability.   About Trusted Autonomous Systems   TAS (initially established as Australia’s first Defence cooperative research centre) is an innovation R&D house uniquely equipped to deliver world-leading robotic and autonomous systems with artificial intelligence (RAS-AI) to enable trusted and effective cooperation between humans and machines. TAS conducts disruptive innovation in trusted autonomous systems to transform the ADF and grow sovereign Australian capabilities.   Our aim is to foster a competitive, productive and sustainable Australian industry primed to develop and deliver world-leading autonomous and robotic Defence technologies; build innovative Intellectual Property through targeted research and technology programs; and assist Australian industry to evaluate and showcase innovative autonomous technologies through capability demonstrations.    Specifically, TAS:   develops highly self-sufficient and survivable systems  develops highly self-determining and self-aware systems  develops human-autonomy systems that are human and context aware  increases the speed to reach a deployable state for trusted autonomous systems  increases the scalability and reduce the cost of autonomous systems technology solutions  educates in the ethics and legal aspects of autonomous systems  informs national policy and regulation discussions      About TAS Projects   TAS projects are defence-driven, industry-led and research-based, delivering sustainable disruptive autonomous systems capability to the nation, driven by our ambition to transform how Defence fights and wins. The current portfolio of projects is extensive, spanning operational domains and key enablers, with strong growth in the scale and scope of the portfolio expected in the years ahead.    Projects align to our “smart, small and many” vision, exploiting AI, miniaturisation and new methods of manufacturing to develop low-cost autonomous systems that can be deployed at scale to create unprecedented mass and combat weight advantages, leading to greater freedom of manoeuvre for the commander. Systems developed through projects not only deliver game-changing capabilities, but also adhere to the legal, regulatory and ethical frameworks governing Defence, ensuring trusted autonomy aligned to social expectations and national and international obligations.   Projects grow sustainable sovereign Australian industry capability, strengthen industry-academic partnership, promote research-translation, and act as change agents, providing Defence with new tools to “shape, deter and respond”. We are committed to the fail-fast approach, accepting measured but significant innovation risk in our program, and adapting effort, direction and investment accordingly to maximise impact for Defence and the nation.   Projects are commercially sensitive, and so limited information is available to external audiences. However, a few examples of the scale and ambition of our projects can be found on our website ‘what we do’ and ‘news’.    About the Role   The successful candidate will lead the networking and communications elements in the rapid development of a common command and control system for Defence. The system will be used to support structured experimentation of developmental robotic and autonomous systems in operational scenarios, with an initial focus on an integrated common C2 system for multi-robot operations in the land domain. The successful candidate can also expect to participate across other projects in the maritime and air domains.    You will work with the TAS Chief Technology Officer Team and other important stakeholders, including our Defence partners, to enhance the system architecture, implement design, and support test and evaluation activities. You will work with the project lead and senior software engineer to guide the project toward short-term delivery (<1 year), with key milestones in September 2024 and June 2025. You will support software development activities as appropriate and participate in field experimentation of the common C2 solution.    TAS is headquartered in Brisbane, this is a Brisbane based position.    The role is scoped for a full-time applicant for 12 months, with potential for extension. The successful applicant will ultimately take on an expanded role across two other programmes due to commence in the next financial year, forming a core part of the growing TAS delivery team. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute during the early phases of a potentially significant expansion of TAS’ technical program.    Remuneration   Remuneration for this position is set at >$165,000 plus superannuation, dependent upon the experience of the successful applicant.    About You   You must have a results-driven and proactive approach to development. To meet rapid development timeframes, you must be comfortable working collaboratively, making prioritisation decisions, and communicating risk. You are familiar with, or willing to learn about, command and control concepts and technologies as they apply to autonomous systems, heterogeneous teams, and Defence activities.    You will demonstrate flexibility in your contribution to development and deployment efforts and must be capable of ready discussion with stakeholders to ensure delivery in accordance with expectations. You should have sufficient experience to support independent work and the ability to make informed decisions on behalf of the software team to achieve project objectives.    Essential Requirements   The following requirements are mandatory:   Experience in network architecture specification and implementation.   Expert knowledge of Wireless WAN/LAN, Ethernet, VPN’s and various network topologies.  Experience with Linux-based operating systems and networks.  Experience with rapid/agile development processes.   Experience with hardware/software integration.   Experience with software containerisation and deployment technologies including Docker  Experience with third-party product integration.   Experience with collaborative software development environments.   Reside in Australia.   Currently hold, or be eligible to hold, an AGSVA security clearance at NV1.    Desirable Requirements   The following requirements are desirable:   An understanding of command and control functions and architectures, relevant standards and protocols.   Previous experience in a DevOps role  Experience with acoustic communications.   Familiarity with Defence experimentation or Defence operations.   Proficiency in at least one compiled programming language, e.g. Go, Java or C++.  Application   To apply, submit applications via the Seek job listing. Applications must include a cover letter addressing the selection criteria, a CV, and two current references by COB 17 August 2024  Questions can be directed to info@tasdcrc.com.au.

column13: Applications close 17 August 2024  Target start date 26 August 2024  Brisbane based position     Autonomous Systems Network Engineer   Trusted Autonomous Systems (TAS) requires an experienced network engineer keen to work directly with TAS - a proven innovation specialist in the Robotics, Autonomous Systems and Artificial Intelligence (RAS-AI) domain - and our Defence partners, to accelerate RAS-AI technology transfer into capability.   About Trusted Autonomous Systems   TAS (initially established as Australia’s first Defence cooperative research centre) is an innovation R&D house uniquely equipped to deliver world-leading robotic and autonomous systems with artificial intelligence (RAS-AI) to enable trusted and effective cooperation between humans and machines. TAS conducts disruptive innovation in trusted autonomous systems to transform the ADF and grow sovereign Australian capabilities.   Our aim is to foster a competitive, productive and sustainable Australian industry primed to develop and deliver world-leading autonomous and robotic Defence technologies; build innovative Intellectual Property through targeted research and technology programs; and assist Australian industry to evaluate and showcase innovative autonomous technologies through capability demonstrations.    Specifically, TAS:   develops highly self-sufficient and survivable systems  develops highly self-determining and self-aware systems  develops human-autonomy systems that are human and context aware  increases the speed to reach a deployable state for trusted autonomous systems  increases the scalability and reduce the cost of autonomous systems technology solutions  educates in the ethics and legal aspects of autonomous systems  informs national policy and regulation discussions      About TAS Projects   TAS projects are defence-driven, industry-led and research-based, delivering sustainable disruptive autonomous systems capability to the nation, driven by our ambition to transform how Defence fights and wins. The current portfolio of projects is extensive, spanning operational domains and key enablers, with strong growth in the scale and scope of the portfolio expected in the years ahead.    Projects align to our “smart, small and many” vision, exploiting AI, miniaturisation and new methods of manufacturing to develop low-cost autonomous systems that can be deployed at scale to create unprecedented mass and combat weight advantages, leading to greater freedom of manoeuvre for the commander. Systems developed through projects not only deliver game-changing capabilities, but also adhere to the legal, regulatory and ethical frameworks governing Defence, ensuring trusted autonomy aligned to social expectations and national and international obligations.   Projects grow sustainable sovereign Australian industry capability, strengthen industry-academic partnership, promote research-translation, and act as change agents, providing Defence with new tools to “shape, deter and respond”. We are committed to the fail-fast approach, accepting measured but significant innovation risk in our program, and adapting effort, direction and investment accordingly to maximise impact for Defence and the nation.   Projects are commercially sensitive, and so limited information is available to external audiences. However, a few examples of the scale and ambition of our projects can be found on our website ‘what we do’ and ‘news’.    About the Role   The successful candidate will lead the networking and communications elements in the rapid development of a common command and control system for Defence. The system will be used to support structured experimentation of developmental robotic and autonomous systems in operational scenarios, with an initial focus on an integrated common C2 system for multi-robot operations in the land domain. The successful candidate can also expect to participate across other projects in the maritime and air domains.    You will work with the TAS Chief Technology Officer Team and other important stakeholders, including our Defence partners, to enhance the system architecture, implement design, and support test and evaluation activities. You will work with the project lead and senior software engineer to guide the project toward short-term delivery (<1 year), with key milestones in September 2024 and June 2025. You will support software development activities as appropriate and participate in field experimentation of the common C2 solution.    TAS is headquartered in Brisbane, this is a Brisbane based position.    The role is scoped for a full-time applicant for 12 months, with potential for extension. The successful applicant will ultimately take on an expanded role across two other programmes due to commence in the next financial year, forming a core part of the growing TAS delivery team. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute during the early phases of a potentially significant expansion of TAS’ technical program.    Remuneration   Remuneration for this position is set at >$165,000 plus superannuation, dependent upon the experience of the successful applicant.    About You   You must have a results-driven and proactive approach to development. To meet rapid development timeframes, you must be comfortable working collaboratively, making prioritisation decisions, and communicating risk. You are familiar with, or willing to learn about, command and control concepts and technologies as they apply to autonomous systems, heterogeneous teams, and Defence activities.    You will demonstrate flexibility in your contribution to development and deployment efforts and must be capable of ready discussion with stakeholders to ensure delivery in accordance with expectations. You should have sufficient experience to support independent work and the ability to make informed decisions on behalf of the software team to achieve project objectives.    Essential Requirements   The following requirements are mandatory:   Experience in network architecture specification and implementation.   Expert knowledge of Wireless WAN/LAN, Ethernet, VPN’s and various network topologies.  Experience with Linux-based operating systems and networks.  Experience with rapid/agile development processes.   Experience with hardware/software integration.   Experience with software containerisation and deployment technologies including Docker  Experience with third-party product integration.   Experience with collaborative software development environments.   Reside in Australia.   Currently hold, or be eligible to hold, an AGSVA security clearance at NV1.    Desirable Requirements   The following requirements are desirable:   An understanding of command and control functions and architectures, relevant standards and protocols.   Previous experience in a DevOps role  Experience with acoustic communications.   Familiarity with Defence experimentation or Defence operations.   Proficiency in at least one compiled programming language, e.g. Go, Java or C++.  Application   To apply, submit applications via the Seek job listing. Applications must include a cover letter addressing the selection criteria, a CV, and two current references by COB 17 August 2024  Questions can be directed to info@tasdcrc.com.au.

column13: Data Governance Manager  Full-time  Camberwell, VIC  About Us  At Baptcare, we care. Our Mission and Vision are lived through our WE CARE Values: for our residents, customers, clients, partners, and supporters; with the very young through to the very old, the vulnerable, with families through all of life’s stages and challenges.  Baptcare is a purpose driven organisation working across Victoria, Tasmania, and South Australia. Focused on providing residential and community care for older people and support to children, families, and people with disability, financially disadvantaged people and people seeking asylum.  Our Values are Wellbeing, Ethics, Co-creating, Accountability, Respect and Effectiveness​. ​  About the Role  The Data Governance Manager provides data governance expertise to business units and is responsible for overseeing and managing Baptcare’s data governance program. This role is the conduit between Baptcare management and employees or vendors in the application and adherence to the data governance framework and policies.  Key Responsibilities:  Oversee, provide leadership, and guide project teams to ensure data governance is applied to all projects. Develop and maintain business domain knowledge, data skills and awareness of data management and data governance practices, procedures, and trends. Offer expert knowledge and guidance on data governance best practices, policies, and procedures. Co-ordinate the data governance program Contribute to the creation of and implementation of Data Governance Framework and the delivery of roadmap initiatives. Ensure policies and plans are communicated and educate all business areas on data governance. Specify and co-ordinate data strategy metrics collection, auditing, and reporting processes, including to the Executive and Board where required. Identify and utilise opportunities for continuous data governance improvement. Provide data governance guidance on the management of risks associated with the use of data, including balancing security and privacy against the benefits of collecting and sharing data. Perform routine assessments or audits to identify improvement opportunities and action the.     About You:  Proven leadership experience in a data governance senior management role with a strong track record of successfully delivering complex projects and initiatives. Knowledge and experience of data governance frameworks (DAMA/DCAM), principles and methodologies. Experience with cloud-based data governance tools (e.g., Informatica, Alation, Collibra) A strong understanding of data management principles, including data quality, metadata management, and data lineage The ability to create and deliver training and awareness programs on data governance and data management best practices Strong communication skills with a proven history of influencing organisational data practices and policies Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with senior management, technical and non- technical employees, and vendors Ability to build and maintain relationships with stakeholders and vendor     It is essential to have:     Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field.  5+ years’ experience of successfully delivering complex Data Governance programs in a regulated environment. Certification in one or more data Governance methodologies (e.g., DAMA)     It is desirable that you have:     Relevant certifications in data governance Project Management Qualifications and / or experience Experience in Aged Care, Community Services or Not-for-Profit/NGO organisations.  For You  Baptcare is focused on living our values, not just talking about them. You’ll find the culture at Baptcare is one of genuine respect, support, and positive intention. We work hard to achieve results through change, continuous improvement, and ongoing focus on providing the best service delivery to our stakeholders.   Further, the successful candidate will receive:  Work with a supportive and dynamic team. A competitive salary, plus access to the tax benefits of salary packaging and novated leasing. Career and development opportunities. Access to confidential counselling and support services. Be part of an organisation and a team that is driven to make a difference to the lives of our vulnerable community members.     How to Apply  Click 'Apply Now' to submit your application.   Please submit as soon as possible as interviews will commence early!  Only short-listed applicants will be contacted.  Applicants must have the right to work in Australia. The successful applicant will be required to undergo a National Criminal History check.  If you require support with the application process, please contact gvenizelos@baptcare.org.au  At Baptcare, we value diversity in all forms and aim to co-create inclusive experiences and communities with our employees, volunteers, the people we work alongside and our partners. We are committed to diversity and inclusion across all we do and to building communities and workplaces where everyone belongs.  Baptcare is dedicated to the safety, empowerment, and participation of all children. We have zero tolerance of child abuse and are committed to a thoughtful, protective environment that supports infants, children, and young people to feel safe and respected.

column3: Ensure high-quality work by applying your comprehensive knowledge of Telecommunications land access legislation to the organisation's activities.
column13: The Opportunity  Are you passionate about town planning, environmental sciences, and telecommunications? Do you thrive on ensuring statutory approvals and stakeholder engagements are meticulously managed? Join our dynamic team as a Land Access Advisor and make a significant impact on Australia's telecommunications infrastructure with the flexibility to work from home once fully trained in the role requirements. Applicants from all across Australia are welcome.     The Company  Mirait Technologies Australia is a leader in the Telecommunications and Energy infrastructure construction and maintenance space. With a focus on delivering superior outcomes to our customers, we are looking for an experienced Land Access Advisor to join our team.  To discuss this opportunity further, please contact our Recruitment team on 02 4329 9900 or at careers@mirait.com.au.     The Role  Reporting to the Land Access Manager, the Land Access Advisor is responsible for undertaking assigned Land Access Statutory Approvals (LASA) works in a timely and quality manner while ensuring all aspects of the Telecommunications Act 1997 and the Telecommunications Code of Practice are applied and adhered to in the production of detailed designs, field inspections and construction activities.  Duties will include but not be limited to:  Work collaboratively with key internal and external stakeholders to ensure a clear understanding of land access, stakeholder engagement and statutory approval functions and requirements, Assist in resolving escalated land access, stakeholder engagement and statutory approval matters as appropriate, Produce Land Access deliverables including Planning Assessment Reports, notifications, Review of Environmental Factors, Heritage Management Plans Develop and manage the implementation of a state-based statutory approval authority and internal/external stakeholder engagement program, Act as a Subject Matter Expert to state-based functional staff in dealing with operational, guidance, policy, statutory & legal matters, cross train other team members as required.    You:  To secure an interview for this great local opportunity, it is desirable to meet the following:  Relevant qualifications in Town Planning/Environmental Sciences, Minimum 2 years industry experience in Land Access procedures in complex CAN and IEN networks and associated infrastructure, Proven working understanding of Telecommunications Act 1997, Federal Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act (EPBC) 1999 requirements for land use and construction-related activities, Excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills, as you will liaise with team members from different disciplines, clients, and government agencies to ensure delivery of innovative solutions that meet client and broader community expectations, Extensive town planning or environmental science work experience, Considerable knowledge of the strategies, methods, techniques, and practices of telecommunication construction, Knowledge of health, safety, environment and quality regulations and legal requirements. High level of attention to detail, and strong competency with GIS programs and MS Office Suite.     Benefits:  Flexibility to work from home once fully trained in the role requirements. Utilise your knowledge of the Telecommunications Act 1997 and the Telecommunications Code of Practice, Supportive, friendly, and collaborative team environment, Access to the company Employee Assistance Program, Commitment to your ongoing professional development.     Diversity:  At MIRAIT Technologies Australia, we're dedicated to being an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering a safe, diverse, and inclusive workplace where every team member feels valued. Recognising that diversity enhances our collective strength, we believe in embracing individuals from diverse backgrounds, cultures, genders, and abilities, creating equal opportunities for all. Upholding a strict policy against any form of harassment, we prioritise nurturing a workplace where all feel safe to thrive.  Join us in our endeavour to construct a workplace characterised by mutual respect, appreciation, and empowerment. If you do require an adjustment during the recruitment process or wish to understand more about the opportunity, please contact Verity Quinsey on 02 4329 9952 or email careers@mirait.com.au. All of your information will be treated as confidential in accordance with the Privacy Act 1988.     Mirait has zero tolerance for drug & alcohol use and any candidates will undergo pre-employment testing prior to offers being made.

column13: About The ABC  The ABC is the nation's most trusted and independent source of Australian conversations, culture, and stories. Key Accountabilities:  Under broad direction of technical lead, build and support cloud-based media transcoding and delivery services for ABC content. Apply DevOps practices to develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines supporting digital products. Improve product reliability and quality by integrating monitoring, reporting and fault handling into platforms. In collaboration with Agile teams, participate in planning and review meetings, and contribute to the management of projects to ensure project deliverables are completed within an agreed delivery time. Actively promote the ABC values and apply all relevant workplace policies and guidelines. Cooperate with any reasonable instruction, procedure or policy relating to safety and take reasonable care of your own safety and that of other people who may be affected by your conduct while at work.   About You:  Relevant tertiary qualifications or equivalent industry certifications, and/or skills, knowledge and experience on the Internet and media industries. Enterprise experience developing services in Node JS and open to learn Golang, if no prior experience Experience developing complex, secure, and high-performance software for a range of platforms and devices at scale. Demonstrated outstanding knowledge and experience in assessing, selecting, and using modern frameworks and build tools, implementing automated/unit testing, and version control branching, merging and versioning strategies.  Experience developing highly available services in cloud and technologies such as containerized applications and serverless processes. Ability to write high quality and testable code. Demonstrated effective verbal and written communication skills with a strong ability to foster an open and creative approach to development that shares ideas, skills, and knowledge across teams. Good to have: Media transcoding or streaming (audio or video) experience using AWS Media services  What’s In It For You?  Come and join the vibrant Digital Product department that values innovation at the ABC. Our mission is to enable ABC’s digital future, where ABC transitions from a traditional broadcaster to Australia’s most trusted and valued digital media organisation. Through harnessing our talents in digital, collaborating with our partners and delivering beyond expectations, we ensure the ABC not just remains relevant but thrives.  As a group of product and platform teams, we develop and maintain the ABC's audience facing digital products across mobile, connected TV, desktop, and smart speakers. Whether it is staying informed of the latest breaking news, bringing some great TV on iview, streaming the Hottest 100 on the triple j app and website, or entertaining the kids with our ABC Kids app - the ABC's Digital Product offerings are some of Australia's most loved and most used platforms.  Rich data underpins all of our audience facing products. This role will give you the opportunity to create and enhance our vision to adapt cutting edge Data Mesh concepts to get the most out of the data that ABC collects and manages.  We are committed to career development and invest in our people to grow and become leaders in their fields. Everyone in the Digital Product department has a designated budget for training and development. We believe in flexible approaches to working and building self-organising and collaborative teams that offer friendly and supportive environments in which all team members can strive and grow. You can get a sneak peek into our product engineering world through our blog: https://www.abc.net.au/digital-product  For further information on this position please contact Jamie Nedved, Digital Talent Acquisition Lead via email Nedved.Jamie@abc.net.au  In line with our focus on diversity, applications are strongly encouraged from Indigenous Australians, people from a range of cultural and linguistic backgrounds, people with disability and LGBTIQA+ individuals. column13: We've been trusted to serve Aussie communities since 1914 and grown to become a top 30-listed on the ASX with 120,000 team members and a portfolio of iconic brands. At Coles Group, you'll not only get to make a difference to millions of Aussie lives—you'll also get to see your impact.  Associate Product Manager (122974)   Swaggle is Australia's happiest online pet store. We exist to deliver pet happiness to every doorstep with a wide-range of Australia's leading brands, personalised product suggestions and free vet advice when you create a pet profile. Our mission is to guide you through your pet parenting journey and help every pet find their Swaggle!   At Swaggle, we're more than just a store; we're a community of passionate pet lovers committed to making pet care easy and enjoyable.   What is a Swaggle? Swaggle is defined as the exact moment your pet displays happiness through joyful movement.   About the Team  This is a unique opportunity to become part of an ASX 50-backed joint venture with Coles. All the benefits and budget of one of Australia's largest retailers but culture of a startup, this is an opportunity to join us in shaping the future of pet retail for the better and finding more ways to care and spoil our pets. We're not winning till your pets grinning.   About the Role  As an Associate Product Manager, you'll play a key role in product enablement at Swaggle. This means you will work with a passionate team to further integrate our ERP and improve processes that ensure an outstanding customer fulfilment experience.   In this role you will support defining the backlog to ensure it aligns with the business and product strategies, as well as contributing to the end-to-end execution of initiatives, from discovery to delivery. You will be required to deliver prioritised backlog initiatives to support delivery of quarterly objectives and improve team best practices and processes.   You have demonstrated knowledge of the product lifecycle and experience building and shipping product experiences. You have a strong understanding of the broader digital ecosystem including software development lifecycle, development methodologies (including agile), user experience design, usability and accessibility etc   You are highly collaborative, able to engage and collaborate with a diverse range of stakeholders and people enjoy working with you. You Listen well, build consensus, drive hard decisions and push the pace.   Your stakeholder management skills are exceptional as you will be required to communicates progress of initiatives to stakeholders and will be responsible for the results and customer/business outcomes. You are skilled in translating business process and customer insights into product concepts and solutions.   Ideally you have experience working with ERP systems (NetSuite) and warehouse systems to support customer fulfilment improvements.  About you and your skills  • A minimum of 2 years' experience as a Junior / Associate Product Manager or Business Analyst. • A consistent history of delivering measurable results for both customers and the business • Experience delivering product features using agile principles • Experience in an online retail environment is a must • Experienced in communicating and rationalising product /process design decisions • Experience working in fast paced environments and comfortable with change  If you enjoy solving complex problems, making impactful decisions, and seeing your ideas come to life quickly, this role is perfect for you.  Take your next step into something bigger, apply now  With us it's not about the discounts (although you do get those), it's about joining a team where your wellbeing and professional development is our investment and celebrating your contributions is the norm. And because everyone leads unique lives, we offer flexible work, additional leave and parental leave entitlements.  We're continuing to build a gender equitable team, and a culture that is just as diverse, inclusive and welcoming as the communities we serve. We are committed to creating a workplace that is safe and respectful for our team. We encourage applications from people of all ages, cultures (including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples), abilities, sexual orientation and gender identities.  We're happy to adjust our recruitment process to support candidates with disability. column3: Play a pivotal role in guiding software development partners onto the Global Payments payment platforms, developing & leading best practice solutions
column13: About Us     Through local expertise and global scale, we at Global Payments Oceania deliver market-leading technology solutions through five regional sub-brands — Eway, Ezidebit, Sentral, Pigeonhole Software and Storman.     Collectively, these brands are anchored by Global Payments, a world leader in payments and software solutions and a Fortune 500® brand with a worldwide footprint to accelerate our customers' full potential.     As pioneers within the Australia and New Zealand payments landscape, Eway is a leading business-to-business ecommerce provider and Ezidebit a digital recurring business-to-consumer payments.     About the role     Reporting directly to the Head of Partner Acquisition, the Partner Solutions Architect role forms a key part of the Partner Acquisition Team for AU/NZ and plays a pivotal role in guiding software development partners onto the Global Payments payment platforms, developing and leading best practice solutions that aligns strongly to the GP Oceania value proposition.     You will also:     Develop and maintain a comprehensive technical understanding of our API suite and relevant partner APIs; Design and recommend solutions for partners and large merchants, including proof of concepts, demonstrations, installations, troubleshooting, and training; Troubleshoot and resolve API integration issues with partners and clients; Lead client meetings to develop and implement solutions, both virtually and on-site; Respond to technical queries from partners with a customer-centric approach; Contribute and assist with maintaining internal documentation, knowledge base articles and training materials to support and uplift the knowledge of all internal stakeholders; Maintain and contribute to external API documentation for developers and integrators; Participate and lead the training of stakeholders in the correct use and integration of our API’s; Provide exceptional customer service in all interactions.        About you     You are passionate about understanding customers and have a strong commercial acumen and effectively align solutions that deliver mutual benefit and a sustainable technical outcome.     In addition to having a love for technology and curious mindset, you will also bring:  A minimum of 3 years of relevant experience working with API technologies in a prior Pre-Sales or Solutions Architect role;  Ability to drive detailed conversations regarding technical requirements with a sales led focus in large groups and teams; Ability to acquire a broad understanding of integration API's; Previous exposure to software development; Experience in working with and consuming REST API's and an understanding of key API concepts; Ability to write basic SQL queries to extract and analyse data; Be practical and analytical with the aptitude and capability to learn quickly and with a positive attitude.     Nice to haves:     Prior software development experience preferred but not mandatory; Exposure to high volume transactional environments would be advantageous; Exposure to enterprise software solutions; Knowledge or experience with PCI DSS.     Our Benefits     We want you to be you! At Global Payments we are committed to an inclusive workplace where you can be your true self, feel supported and nurtured.   We understand the struggle of the juggle - the balance of work and personal life can be challenging. Entity Framework, Vue 3 Framework and DevExpress web components. ASP.NET application. Azure cloud hosting and services. Identity Server 4.  Role Requirements  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. column13: The opportunity Our client is a large federal government agency. They have a great opportunity for an EL1 Environments Manager with strong Salesforce administration and environments management experience to join a large Salesforce implementation and development program, and lead a team of Environments Engineers.   Richmond based, 2 days per week in office, hybrid work from home Great rates negotiable, 12 months initial contract plus future extensions Federal government role - must have Australian Citizenship   The role As the Environments Manager, your responsibilities may include but are not limited to:   Assist the Director with overall team strategy and planning Manage the environments team and its service delivery to support development teams, the release program and to ensure all environments are available, secure and up to date Provide delivery management and technical leadership to the environments team Develop service delivery and resource plans to ensure all Salesforce and MuleSoft environment needs are met Develop and maintain Salesforce environment plans Execute hands-on critical and complex Salesforce administration tasks to support releases, CI/CD and new projects and environment changes Ensure standards and support processes are continually reviewed and improved Seek out automation opportunities for improved management of the Salesforce landscape Troubleshoot Salesforce issues and work with internal parties and external vendors to resolve them Develop environment and code management plans to support Release plans to deploy projects and BAU fixes into Production Manage support tickets with Salesforce & maintain platform security Ensure documentation on processes, policies, and configuration is developed and maintained Evaluate new releases of Salesforce to determine functionality requirements and provide detailed information on how changes will apply to all affected departments/users Assign work activities, mentor and provide support to the environments team. Provide support for Salesforce projects and work with team members including Developers, Testers, Project Managers, Cyber Security, Architects and Business Analysts   About you To be considered for these roles you will need:   Significant Salesforce experience, and certifications in Salesforce Administration ADM201 and ADM211 Strong experience in DevOps, and environment engineering and management Strong Agile experience, including service delivery management, and the ability to engage with a wide range of stakeholders Demonstrable experience in administration and configuration of Salesforce Vlocity, Service Cloud, Einstein Analytics and/or Health Cloud and in using GitLab for Salesforce deployments   Please note that our client is a federal government department and they can only consider applicants who are Australian Citizens.  Apply: Please submit your resume ASAP. For more information, please call Jarrodd on 0438 661 623 or email jarrodd.edwards@talentinternational.com.

column3: 6 month contract with a major utilities client, you will be focused on ensuring the successful migration of data from legacy systems to SAP.
column13: A major utilities client is transforming its Enterprise Asset Management and Enterprise Resource Planning systems. They are seeking a skilled Functional Data Analyst with SAP Supply Chain Management (SCM) expertise to join their Data Migration Team. This role is crucial for migrating data from legacy systems to SAP.  Whilst the preference is for someone located in Brisbane, they will consider fully remote within Australia. You must hold unrestricted working rights to be considered.   Key Responsibilities:  Ensure comprehensive documentation for migration design. Collaborate on data migration designs and support developers in implementing processes. Assist in preparing and validating data with Business SMEs. Identify dependencies and support migration planning. Address defects, conduct root cause analysis, and communicate updates to the team. Technical Requirements:  Proficiency in SAP EAM data and processes; 5+ years functional experience in SAP SCM implementation / suppport Strong knowledge of SAP SCM data and processes, including integration with SCM, Finance, and other modules. Proficiency in the SAP SCM data model. Experience in designing and executing data migration processes. Excellent interpersonal and documentation skills.  For more information on this opportunity please contact Matthew Walsh at BLACKROC for a confidential chat. Alternatively, if this isn’t the right opportunity for you but you’re interested in other opportunities within the Data, Cloud & Infrastructure industry in Brisbane, feel free to contact me. matthew.walsh@blackroc.co

column13: About the role:  The Functional Data Analyst will be responsible for overseeing the successful migration of data from sources systems into SAP through the following activities:  Review of target data model designs to confirm required definitions and governance rules are documented to a sufficient level to support the migration design. Development of functional designs for migration of data through collaboration with Functional Specialists and Business SMEs. Providing functional support for Data Migration developers to ensure build of migration processes as designed. Selection Criteria:  Proficient in SAP EAM data and processes: 5+ years’ functional experience in SAP SCM implementations and /or support. Experience working on large-scale SAP data migrations with core focus in Enterprise Asset Management. Sound understanding of SCM configuration and dependent master data. An eye for detail; ability to analyse and validate datasets against a target data model to identify issues with completeness or accuracy. Expertise in data migration activities; cleansing, mapping, validation, reconciliation and issue resolution. If you are interested in this role please apply below or contact Carol Ferraz at carol.ferraz@mtr.com.au
